p: Acosta et al. [ 236] studied the antifungal activity and film properties of cinnamon bark, clove, and oregano EO incorporated on starch gelatin films. EOs had no significant impact on water vapor and oxygen permeability; however, they increased the transparency of the films. The three films containing EO inhibited the growth of Fusarium oxysporum and Colletotrichum gloeosporioides due to their phenolic compounds: eugenol, carvacrol, and thymol. However, cinnamon bark EO films were recommended to protect the spoilage from Fusarium oxysporum.
